result.execSummary:
The defendant Darnell Lamonte Harris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: Count 2 but consecutive with any other sentence, with credit for 3 days time served.
Huber privileges under Sec. 303.08 Wis Stats for school/treatment/child care to apply.

miscConds.notes:
Court sets restitution at $0.
Court costs and victim/witness surcharges to be paid during the term of probation; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge during term of probation; non payment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Maintain employment or be attending school.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; he also may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.

Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification program.
Successfully complete a parenting program.

AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: Count 1 but consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 3 days time served. 
Huber privileges under Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats for school/treatment/child care to apply.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darnell Lamonte Harris

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Darnell Lamonte Harris in court with attorney Daryl A. Kastenson. Ron Dague for Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
AS TO COUNTS 1 and 2:
  Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms; also defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Case calenadared for SENTENCING on 12/19/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant Darnell Lamonte Harris in court with attorney Daryl A. Kastenson.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defendant had to leave to atend his aunts funeral. Case rescheduled for PLEA and SENTENCING on 10/24/2014 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.

Defendant Darnell Lamonte Harris in court with attorney Daryl A. Kastenson. Zach Wittchow for Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Court grants defense request for a short adjournment. Case rescheduled for PROJECTED PLEA on 9/19/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.
Per Chief Judge Directive of 14-08, parties are advised that effective August 3, 2014 this case will be assigned to Branch 15, Judge J. D. Watts, in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.

Defendant Darnell Lamonte Harris in court with attorney Daryl A. Kastenson.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.

Defendant Darnell Lamonte Harris in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Hearing on motion to suppress proceeds.  Sworn-in for the State:  Milwaukee Police Officer Steven Jegen; Exhibit #1, marked, identified, offered and received into evidence; Exhibit #2 marked, identified.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Defense asks Court to take judicial notice of the trespassing code in the State of Wisconsin.  Court marks that as Exhibit # 3 and admits it into evidence.  Defense rests.  Testimony closed.  Arguments by counsel.  Court finds the officer had a legal basis to stop the defendant; had probable cause to arrest the defendant and subject to the arrest find the evidence.  Court denies the defense motion.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Darnell Lamonte Harris in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense was just provided with a CD and would like to review it before the motion.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 27, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
State's Response to Defendant's Motion to Suppress received and filed./ds
Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress Evidence received and filed./ds

Defendant Darnell Lamonte Harris in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Matter before court for motion hearing.  For reasons stated on the record, defense counsel requests a new motion hearing date.  Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 44.  Any motions to be filed no later than 5-30-2014, responses due no later than 6-06-2014.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 4, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Darnell Lamonte Harris in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Motions to be filed by 4-30-14; response/reply to be filed by 5-14-14.  Motion hearing scheduled for May 23, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for 04-16-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Darnell Lamonte Harris in court with attorney Daryl A. Kastenson.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  City of Milwaukee Police Dept. Officer Sergio Rentas.  Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding Case #10CM004293 that are attached to the complaint.  Exhibit # 1 offered and received.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Exhibit # 1 withdrawn.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 44.
Clerk:  jms

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Darnell Lamonte Harris in court with attorney Daryl A. Kastenson.  Defendant Darnell Lamonte Harris in custody.  Karine E. O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant pled not guilty TO MISDEMEANOR COUNT 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge KONKOL, Branch 44.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
